Package AVLTree345

Class AVLTree

java.lang.Object
AVLTree345.AVLTree
public class AVLTree extends Object
AVLTree class represents a self-balancing binary search tree (AVL tree). This implementation provides functionalities such as insertion, deletion, and searching while ensuring the tree remains balanced.

  • Field Details

    • root

      public AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node root
      The root node of the AVL tree.

  • Constructor Details

    • AVLTree

      public AVLTree()
      Constructs an empty AVL tree. Initializes the tree with no nodes (nodeCount = 0), a null root, and a height of 0.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the AVL tree is empty.
      Returns:
      True if the tree is empty (no nodes), false otherwise.

    • height

      public int height()
      Returns the height of the AVL tree. The height is the number of edges in the longest path from the root to a leaf node.
      Returns:
      The height of the tree.

    • size

      public int size()
      Retrieves the number of nodes in the AVL tree.
      Returns:
      The total number of nodes in the tree.

    • root

      public AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node root()
      Provides access to the root node of the AVL tree.
      Returns:
      The root node of the tree.

    • get

      public AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node get(int val)
      Searches for a node with a specific integer value in the AVL tree.
      Parameters:
      val - The integer value to search for in the tree.
      Returns:
      The node that contains the specified value if it exists in the tree, otherwise returns null.

    • insert

      public void insert(int val)
      Inserts a new node with a specified value into the AVL tree. This method calls the recursive helper function `insertHelper` to find the correct position for the new node.
      Parameters:
      val - The integer value to insert into the tree.

    • insertHelper

      public AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node insertHelper(AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node node, int val)
      Recursive helper function for inserting a new node into the AVL tree. It creates a new Node object with the specified value and finds the correct position in the tree to insert it, maintaining the AVL tree properties.
      Parameters:
      node - The node against which the new value is compared to determine the position for insertion.
      val - The integer value to insert into the AVL tree.
      Returns:
      The root node of the AVL tree after insertion.

    • findHeight

      public int findHeight(AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node node)
      Finds the height of a given node in the AVL tree. The height is the number of edges from the node to the deepest leaf. If the node is null, returns -1, which is useful for balance factor calculations.
      Parameters:
      node - The node of the AVL tree whose height is to be calculated.
      Returns:
      The height of the node, or -1 if the node is null.

    • isBalanced

      public boolean isBalanced(AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node root)
      Checks whether the AVL Tree is balanced starting from the given node. A tree is considered balanced if for every node, the height difference between its left and right subtree is at most one.
      Parameters:
      root - The root node of the AVL tree or subtree to check for balance.
      Returns:
      True if the AVL tree is balanced from the given node, false otherwise.

    • remove

      public AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node remove(AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node root, int val)
      Removes a node with the specified value from the AVL tree. This method handles the cases where the node to be removed has no child, one child, or two children. It ensures that the AVL tree properties are maintained after the removal, rebalancing the tree if necessary.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the tree or subtree from which to remove the node.
      val - The value of the node that is to be removed.
      Returns:
      The root of the tree or subtree after removing the specified node.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Generates a string representation of the AVL tree. If the tree is empty, it returns a message indicating so. Otherwise, it returns a detailed representation of the tree including each node's value and height, and the heights of its left and right subtrees.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the AVL tree.

    • inOrder

      public void inOrder(AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node node)
      Performs an in-order traversal of the AVL tree, printing the values of the nodes. In an in-order traversal, the left subtree is visited first, then the current node, and finally the right subtree.
      Parameters:
      node - The root node of the tree or subtree to traverse.

    • preOrder

      public void preOrder(AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node node)
      Performs a pre-order traversal of the AVL tree, printing the values of the nodes. In a pre-order traversal, the current node is visited first, then the left subtree, and finally the right subtree.
      Parameters:
      node - The root node of the tree or subtree to traverse.

    • postOrder

      public void postOrder(AVLTree345.AVLTree.Node node)
      Performs a post-order traversal of the AVL tree, printing the values of the nodes. In a post-order traversal, the left subtree is visited first, then the right subtree, and finally the current node.
      Parameters:
      node - The root node of the tree or subtree to traverse.
